Groups.Group: Red Hat Software Collections 1 for RHEL 7

Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk rh-eclipse46-bouncycastle
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: rh-eclipse46 bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description:
Updated rh-eclipse46 packages that fixes two bugs are now available for Red Hat Software Collections. The rh-eclipse46 Software Collection includes Eclipse 4.6.1, an integrated development environment (IDE), which is based on the Eclipse Foundation's Neon release train.
This update fixes the following bugs:
* The installation of the rh-eclipse46 Software Collection contains a large number of plug-ins. Previously, the amount of metadata and calculations done by the Eclipse instance for the plug-ins led to a slow initial startup. With this update, the check for uses constraints is disabled by default. As a result, performance is significantly improved during initial startup when Eclipse from the rh-eclipse46 Software Collection is installed alongside Red Hat JBoss Developer Studio. (BZ#1392095)
* Prior to this update, Eclipse used Lucene 5 for search indexing, which no longer supports Lucene 3 indexes. Consequently, Lucene 3 indexes downloaded from external locations could not be read by Eclipse's integrated automatic error reporting tool (AERI), resulting in errors in the log file. The automatic error reporting tool in Eclipse has been ported to use Lucene 4, which is able to read Lucene 3 indexes, and the integrated automatic error reporting tool now works correctly. (BZ#1389302)
In addition, support for Elliptic Curve Point Compression has been disabled. (BZ#1391934)
Users of rh-eclipse46 are advised to upgrade to these updated packages.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
